title: Their Eyes Were Watching God - influence on Janie

content.prompt: Which of the following best describes how Janie felt about the influence of her mother and grandmother on her character?

choices.label: She dismissed it as negligible, but remembered her stern upbringing with appreciation.
She still harbored some resentment, but was confident that she had matured intact.
She believed that she would never understand them and they would never understand her.
She worried that as she grew older she would become more like them instead of freer from their effect.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe how textual details reveal nuances and complexities in characters' relationships with one another.
